meanings.definition: To make a shrill, discordant sound
meanings.sent1: The cat caterwauled in the night, scaring the birds away.
meanings.sent2: The old car caterwauled as it struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The rusty gate caterwauled every time it was opened, sounding like a ghostly wail.
meanings.sent4: The wind caterwauled through the trees, creating an eerie symphony.
meanings.sent5: The kettle caterwauled when it reached boiling point, alerting everyone in the house.

meanings.definition: To complain or protest loudly and bitterly
meanings.sent1: The toddler caterwauled when told it was bedtime, demanding to stay up longer.
meanings.sent2: The customer caterwauled about the poor service at the restaurant, demanding a refund.
meanings.sent3: The student caterwauled about the difficult test, claiming it was unfair.
meanings.sent4: The politician caterwauled about the new policy, calling it a disaster.
meanings.sent5: The cat caterwauled at the closed door, wanting to be let outside.
